Internet, Algorithms, and Society

  2. Week 8: Computational Sociology

Week 8: Computational Sociology

Required reading:

  • Mark Granovetter. The Strength of Weak Ties. American Journal of Sociology 78(6): 1360-1380.
  • Nicholas Cristakis & James Fowler. Connected: The Surprising Power of Our Social Networks and How they Shape Our Lives, Chapter One.
  • Chetty, Raj, Matthew O. Jackson, Theresa Kuchler, Johannes Stroebel, Nathaniel Hendren, Robert B. Fluegge, Sara Gong et al. Social capital I: measurement and associations with economic mobility. Nature (2022): 1-14.

Additional reading:

  • Stanley Milgram. The small world problem, Psychology Today.
  • Smriti Bhagat, Moira Burke, Carlos Diuk, Ismail Onur Filiz, and Sergey Edunov. Three and a half degrees of separation. Facebook Research. 2016.
  • Burke, Moira, and Robert Kraut. Using Facebook after losing a job: Differential benefits of strong and weak ties. In Proceedings of the 2013 conference on Computer supported cooperative work, pp. 1419-1430. 2013.
